Reviews.Title: Great laptop for me
Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: I like the 17.3 inch screen, it works great, and the price was right. I'm so glad I didn't get a laptop with a small 15 inch screen. Battery charges fast. There wasn't a lot of bloatware to remove. Asus has a nice smart gestures utility to suppress any Windows 8 gestures that become annoying. It is fast enough for my purposes and Asus has 24/7 support and 1 year warranty, plus 1 year accidental warranty. I didn't really want Windows 8, but that's what you're gonna get. After 3 weeks intensive training, I now am comfortable with Windows 8. The laptop has really fast wake-up from sleep (they are not kidding when they say 2 seconds). However, it runs warmer than I had expected when the charger is plugged in. On the negative side, there isn't a free period of Windows 8 support for complicated issues from either Asus or Microsoft due to being an OEM copy of Windows. That's probably typical. However, Microsoft will help with minor things free of charge.

Reviews.Title: A sensible choice
Reviews.Author: Joseph M. Deliso "--max"
Reviews.Content: This is a great machine for the price, but there are a few caveats.The hardware is, as usual with ASUS, of excellent quality. The frame is sturdy, the case is a stylish matte black with very understated ornamentation, which I like. The screen produces a surprisingly good looking display, and at 1600x900 it's compatible with standard widescreen media. At 17.3 inches it's just big enough to pull off 16:9 without being a burden on your eyes.  The keyboard's not great, but it's not terrible either. It's tough to be objective about these things when your main keyboard is mechanical. The hardware is mostly great, but there are two areas where it's somewhat deficient.The touchpad leaves a little to be desired. Clicking is very awkward because the left and right mouse buttons are both part of the same panel that you touch to manipulate the mouse. This means that you can still click even if your finger is near the top left hand side of the touchpad, and if you're like me you may do this often, and it may annoy you a lot. ASUS does bundle some software with the machine to do gesture recognition and try and make using the touchpad less painful, and to some extent it does work; they introduced some interesting and thoughtful shortcuts - but it's not enough. The touchpad itself is not sensitive enough to be fit for general use. The good news: if you just plug in a mouse, you don't have to deal with any of this. Also I would recommend using the ASUS configuration software to disable the touchpad when the mouse is plugged in.The other area where the machine is a little sub-par is the audio controller. It's an integrated VIA audio processing chip, and you may notice some noise in playback if you have quality audio hardware. This will worsen significantly if you use an application which attempts to play a bunch of sounds at the same time. Also, the 5mm audio port is reused for headphones and microphones, and sometimes the software fails to detect which is which. It's happened more than once where I plugged in my headphones only to receive an earful of noise. But, again, you can buy external audio playback equipment if this bothers you too much, so it's not a big problem either.The Intel integrated HD Graphics 3000 is more than adequate for everything that's not GPU intensive 3D applications, (read: recent games). The CPU is decently fast. Similar to the GPU, it's just powerful enough that you can do almost all things which fit the profile of modern 'typical use' i.e. web browsing, word processing, etc. without noticing any significant delay. Same goes for the size and speed of the available RAM. Also, if you really need more RAM you can buy some and install it yourself - there is an available slot. (I don't know what effect this will have on the warranty, but it probably won't be pretty). The HDD is not too snappy, but with all of the new boot optimizations in software, you'll barely notice.This brings me to the software. Like it or not, you have no choice in the matter, this system ships with Windows 8 pre-installed (the licensing fee contributes in some small way to the total price of the machine). This particular model does not come with a backup disk nor a means to create one easily, so if you mess up your install and do not know how to fix it then you are dependent on ASUS or a repair shop to fix it for you. They partition the one disk into four parts by default: EFI System, OS Recovery, OS Partition, and Data. The EFI system partition is used to  store specially signed boot images. The OS Recovery partition can be booted into to try and fix whatever is wrong with the OS Partition, and will load after the OS Partition itself fails to load. The Data partition is intended to be used to store, well, data (Music/Movies/Documents etc.). This system is one of many systems to use a new system for booting which obsoletes the old MBR/BIOS based approach, which has some important consequences for you, the consumer. Now, the vendors of the hardware have the power to decide what operating system will run on the device, as well as the power to prevent other operating systems from running. This functionality has been met with heavy opposition from global proponents of software freedom, and the legal and ethical debate continues. This particular system still allows the user to enter the firmware and disable the 'SecureBoot' functionality, but the process requires some technical acumen and is only required if you intend to replace Windows with certain other operating systems. Thusly, installing GNU/Linux on this machine is a little trickier than on the older BIOS based machines, but still possible. Failing that, the i3 2370M supports VT-x and so virtualization is an attractive option if you don't want to take a risk dabbling with the firmware.Aside from the boot concerns, transitioning to Windows 8 from Windows 7 or an earlier version of Windows can be a little jarring. The system seems to be more geared towards a touch sensitive device (which this laptop is not), and the typical user experience is vastly different from prior versions. Only after extensive reconfiguration and tinkering was I able to put the machine into a state that I was comfortable using, but that is of course very personal and your mileage may vary.I give the laptop four out of five stars: the hardware is mostly great but the software not so much. The frame, the general build quality, the screen, and the keyboard are good, but the touchpad and audio controller are a little lacking. The new firmware offers questionable benefit while taking away the consumer freedom, and Windows 8 is still not really suitable for a machine of this form.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy!!
Reviews.Author: bmcallisterx
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why one of the reviews says the computer is slow - I was impressed with the performance. The computer was marked down and included a $100 Amazon gift card for a net sell of $330. Nice display, no glare. With free 2-day Prime shipping, easy set up - I am happily surprised!

Reviews.Title: Fast! Lightweight! Bright Screen!!
Reviews.Author: Dan Spangler
Reviews.Content: Fast! Lightweight! Bright Screen!! Also have had zero issues with the laptop or the software - Very satisfied - Would definitely purchase again. A great laptop for the price !! :)

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an Hp laptop that was old and stopped working. The price is what caught my eye. I talked to a friend at work (in IT) before buying and I was reassured that Asus makes a good product. So far I haven't had any issues. This notebook has lots of features and was a great buy. You can't go wrong for the price.

Reviews.Title: intel i3 2370M 2.4Ghz, Need I say More?
Reviews.Author: Adrian
Reviews.Content: This review is with this PC running Windows 7Pros:PRICEHandles HD Movies Welli3 2370M (CANT WAIT TO TEST VMWARE & GNS3 using this processor)You can downgrade to 7 64-bitPRICECons:WINDOWS 8spent all day downgrading from this windows 8 garbage, back to windows 7 64-bit, and installed all the drivers, from Asus website. Got a copy of windows 7 and did a clean install. ITS WORTH IT. 8 IS FOR TOUCH SCREEN DEVICES, EVERYTHING BACK UP AND RUNNING PERFECT. NOWI PROBABLY WOULD HAVE GIVEN THIS LAPTOP A 5 STAR IF IT WITH 7 LOADED.UPDATE: SOME IMPORTANT THINGS I FORGOT TO ADD....1. THIS LAPTOP HAS ONLY 1 OPEN RAM SLOT. THE 4GB RAM IT COMES WITH IS BUILT IN (SOLDERED ON).WHAT DOES THIS MEAN? IT WILL ONLY SUPPORT UP TO 12GB DDR3 RAM, NOT 16GB. (SHOULD NOT MATTER TO THE AVERAGE USER)2. THE PROCESSOR CAN ONLY TAKE ADVANTAGE ON 1333Mhz DDR3, however you can install 1600Mhz.I Just upgraded this PC to 8GB.Windows Experience Index Rates this PC at 5.8/7.9 (Graphics being the lowest score)

Reviews.Title: Great value, especially when you add more memory, a SSD and Win7
Reviews.Author: R. Noble
Reviews.Content: I ordered this along with a 120GB - Samsung 840 Series Solid State Drive (SSD) with Desktop and Notebook Installation Kit 120 sata_6_0_gb 2.5-Inch MZ-7TD120KW and Kingston Value RAM 4GB 1600MHz PC3-12800 DDR3 Non-ECC CL11 SODIMM SR x8 Notebook Memory (KVR16S11S8/4). I installed the SSD, RAM and Windows 7 Professional. The result is a very fast laptop with an external 500GB hard drive (The hard drive that came in the laptop). The touchpad is very big, but a little awkward to use as the buttons share the same surface as the actual touchpad. This is by no means a mobile workstation, but makes a great home-use laptop.If you go the Windows 7 route, all of the drivers you need can be downloaded here: [...]

Reviews.Title: A good basic laptop
Reviews.Author: Stealthvette
Reviews.Content: I needed a laptop with a large screen because I use it as my desktop and attach another monitor to it for working on spreadsheets for our insurance brokerage. The display is OK but not magnificent it would be nice to have some knobs to control the contrast and color as it is a bright display but kind of washed out.Since I work with primarily business applications that aren't gobbling up huge bandwidth it is a good basic machine with an adequate size (500 gig) hard drive.I did have to struggle with Windows 8 and downloaded some start shells and other gadgets to get the system to work like Win7 so am happy, now.

Reviews.Title: ugh
Reviews.Author: denella
Reviews.Content: I was so used to windows 7 that i really searched every where for it but this laptop only came with windows 8 but ill figure it out it is very user friendly and there are tons of youtube videos that are helpful

Reviews.Title: Grandson tested
Reviews.Author: Julie Taylor
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandson who is in high school. He loves it. The battery life is good.  It's pretty quick and so far my grandson seems to live on it.

Reviews.Title: Overall its value for money... But not apt for Linux users...
Reviews.Author: RENJITH
Reviews.Content: System does not support most of the Linux version... Installing Linux alongside with Windows 8 on this Laptop is not successfully done so far...

Reviews.Title: Good Computer
Reviews.Author: James Murphey
Reviews.Content: Lacking a few things that would have made this computer top notch.ProsQuick start upWindows 8 runs pretty smoothNice feelGreat displayruns coolConsSpeakers are very hard to hear and face downwards- poor designBluetooth is a nightmareBlue tooth to speakers is a bigger nightmareComes with bloatware-not too much but still an annoyanceI have had some flickers on windows and a little laggingOver all it is an okay computer and a good deal for the price.  I recommend getting some speakers to go with it but not Bluetooth or you will be disappointed with the lag in and stuttering in the media.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good laptop for the price.
Reviews.Author: Paul Westall
Reviews.Content: Construction seems solid, keyboard is OK. Windows 8 is about to convert me to Apple.  Is MS really trying to lose customers?This laptop runs slower with Win8 than my 6 year old desktop running Vista.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Purple Girl Reba
Reviews.Content: I love my new lap top. It has so many apps on it and I love how easy it is to find everything. I wasn't sure if I was going to like it in the beginning but after the first week I was sure this was right for me. The key board is different than I have had before, this one has soft keys that are a nicer feel when pushing them. Not sure how to describe it but I love the keyboard. I would recommend this laptop to any of my friends or family. It is a great price for what you get. You will be very happy with this laptop

Reviews.Title: Amazing Warranty
Reviews.Author: AmazonQueen
Reviews.Content: ASUS ADP:  1 year drops, spills, power surges, and fire damageASUS 360:  2 WAY FREE STANDARD SHIPPINGI use this laptop for routine purposes.  I needed something reliable and a great value.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: MOOKIE "Amazonite"
Reviews.Content: Using it to do these reviews. Love the computer, HATE windows 8. Won't ever use windows 8 again. I have had ASUS before and I love that one as well. I hope this one last longer. The other one was an open box and that is probably why it didn't last long. Great price. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop!
Reviews.Author: jd
Reviews.Content: Asus is Definitely the best computer brand out there.  This computer is no exception to the quality of their products.  This is the perfect balance of Performance and Price.  I would Highly recommend this Laptop to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Computer
Reviews.Author: mars "Americanshores"
Reviews.Content: Great buy as an Amazon used Item....It looks and works like brand new....Very fast and enjoy the larger screen.  You will appreciate larger screens as you grow older.....LOL.....Also the only negative thing is that I had to change it from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1  Windows 8 was driving me ape trying to figure out the basic keys of navigation.  Glad I switched it to Windows 8.1  I would have liked to give it a 5 stars rating, but  you need to have a mouse to navigate this computer.  The central navigational pad is very large and does not work well trying to navigate the cursor with your fingers.  Also, because the pad is so large, you must pay attention when typing as your hands will otherwise slide over the pad very easily and mess up the cursor.

Reviews.Title: Happy Happy!
Reviews.Author: Shane Forist
Reviews.Content: My son uses this at college and seems to like it just fine.  He says the battery could be a little better but is happy overall.

Reviews.Title: 1 year using it
Reviews.Author: Carlos Hernandez
Reviews.Content: i been using this laptop just for surf the internet and do some home works.... and its perfect for me ... 1 year working fine

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: Richard Q
Reviews.Content: Great product for the price.  I'm not a huge laptop user at home, but this one works great.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Broken in the box
Reviews.Author: Dave Christensen
Reviews.Content: Only about half of the keys on the keyboard worked.  Couldn't even set it up...I am still waiting on my refund.

Reviews.Title: Nice computer
Reviews.Author: Ed Stowell
Reviews.Content: We saw a demo unit but couldn't find it locally [except out of box sale]- Just wish it hadn't come with Windows 8. Got the same price as they were going to sell the demo unit.

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Been having trouble with it switching resolution after it goes to standby mode which causes my games to not load properly... i have to power off and power on for it to fix it...can't handle WoW on max settings even... so much for HD graphics.  max resolution is 1600x900...

Reviews.Title: Great all around laptop
Reviews.Author: Nathan Murdock
Reviews.Content: Came on time. This is a pretty good durable product, I have had it for month now and it is just great. The reason I rate it 4 stars is because when I first received this it was kind of slow and giving me some problems, however this smoothed out in a week and still runs just fine. I use this computer mostly for gaming. It works rather well for this. The games I play are league of legends, minecraft, and skyrim. This computer s

Reviews.Title: first response....
Reviews.Author: sparky
Reviews.Content: speed and good technology...not all that complicated once I got used to the steps..very touchy pad, had to use a mouse.too bad there are not more Usb ports... to use a flash drive I have to unplug the printer or the mouse....poor planning...Also have to refer to a list of "commands"  (like the days before the mouse)

Reviews.Title: Solid for the price
Reviews.Author: The Sharpened Quill
Reviews.Content: This is a decent laptop for the price. But would I buy it again? No, not if I could afford to spend more. I bought this to replace my Dell 1720 Inspiron.Here's the thing: If you only have five hundred bucks to spend, this is a good buy. But you're going to hate the trackpad with a passion. It's probably the worst design, ever. The bottom portion of the pad is the Left and Right buttons, (it's all one piece,) and it is super stiff, (you really have to press hard,) and the tracking is hyper sensitive, so when you press on the buttons/pad the pointer will usually shoot off to another part of the screen other than what you wanted to click on. So you're really going to have to master the various types of finger taps. There is no native settings app. for the trackpad, so forget about adjusting it.Second is the keyboard. For a 17" laptop, the keyboard layout/size is much more like a 15". That sucks if you're a fast typer, like me. The spacebar will be the next bane of your existence after the trackpad. You really have to hit that sucker. If you don't, you're going to look up to find just one big line of text.Having looked at the field of 17" laptops in this price range, I still think this is a good buy. You just need to understand what you're getting into with the pad and keyboard. The pad is not, 'un-workable', it's just going to take some getting used to. If you can deal with that, I don't think you'll regret getting it.

Reviews.Title: computer is great and light weight
Reviews.Author: Milo Harrison
Reviews.Content: laptop is great, windows 8 is tough to get used to but that's not the laptop's fault.  Worked great right out of the box

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: terry allen
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is a pain! Other than that so far so good. The touch pad is a little tricky though.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with my Asus
Reviews.Author: RoxyAnny
Reviews.Content: I shopped for a long time for a 17" laptop.  I'm glad I held out for the price drop on the machines with Intel i3 to get this one.  The instant on is really nice.  I've adjusted to the keyboard easily.  I do have smallish hands.  Battery life is so-so, for me about 3 hrs,  but not a problem as I went with this size laptop knowing I'm not going to be hauling it around with me very much.  It has everything I want and need: 3 usb ports, HDMI, DVD/DVR, camera & mic, Bluetooth.  Screen resolution is fine for me to surf the 'net, MS office, and stream movies.  One who is a gamer or movie buff will need to put out more $$$ to be satisfied.Cons:  I miss having a backlit keyboard;  placement of speakers often require that I break out the headphones.  I can live with both.I unboxed it, plugged 'er in to charge and she booted up and ran perfectly.  Programs I installed went without a hitch.Now my 2 cents on Windows 8.  It wasn't as much of a nightmare as I thought it would be.  Navigation took a bit of getting used to and some things were hard to find, ie control panel.  I can see how having a touch screen would make the experience a different animal.  At first I thought I would be taking Asus up on the downgrade to Windows 7, but since this is the only computer I own with windows 8 I can always sit down to my desk top if need be.Kudos to Asus for giving the option to downgrade to Windows 7!

Reviews.Title: ASUS Laptop
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Cormier "snoopdog"
Reviews.Content: Laptop arrived quickly and I am so happy with it!!!  It was a good choice at a great price!!  Thank you!

Reviews.Title: LOVE THE LOVE THE LAPTOP NOT CRAZY ABOUT WINDOWS 8 GIVE ME XP OR VISTA ANYDAY.
Reviews.Author: D. CAPONIGRO "MEERKATMOM"
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is guaranteed to drive you nuts until you learn how to handle it.  The ASUS computer is great with a 17.3 inch screenand so far is working just fine.  I am sure when I have mastered windows 8 then it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: A great laptop for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Sanada
Reviews.Content: This is a great Laptop if you don't want purchase a Desktop. It is very well made and functions very well. The only thing I would say I don't like about it is that the speakers are located on the bottom of the laptop and when your laptop is on a surface you do lose some sound, if you have headphones it's not an issue but you won't always be using headphones and it can be annoying. Other than that the Laptop is great and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice screen size
Reviews.Author: Linda Barajas
Reviews.Content: It took a bit to get used to Windows 8, after all, change is hard at first. I do like it now, and the computer itself is very nice, especially for older eyes. I find the larger screen is a big plus and the keys do not seem less responsive than the others I have had (only reason I hesitated on buying when I read a few reviews). I am happy with my purchase.Well it is now January, this does not work unless it is plugged in, and the keyboard has keys that only work if you hammer them while typing.  Please do not purchase this only to be disappointed.  I had bought two different computers from ASUS and the other still works great.

Reviews.Title: Works great, price is right, but too bulky and a nightmare BIOS
Reviews.Author: Steve Britten
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very fast. Great price. 1 Year Accidental Damage Protection from ASUS.Cons: Too bulky. They could have made the LCD frame and palmrest smaller - not sure why they made it so big. Also, the BIOS is the worst I have ever worked with. Trying to set it up to boot from the CD or boot to install a legacy OS is very difficult, even for me, a laptop repair and sales tech with 8 yrs experience working on laptops of all shapes and sizes!if you are buying this to reload it with Windows 7, beware: you may end up giving up on the BIOS reconfig. Asus has made it very, very difficult and cryptic compared to most others I reload.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for great price
Reviews.Author: Le hong nhat
Reviews.Content: This laptop works excellently for its price. With a 17'' screen, watching movies or playing games is just great. And IMO it's pretty light for its size. For a student who wants to study and gaming on a laptop for a low price, this can suit you. You can play some of the recent games like Skyrim, Remember Me, Bioshock Infinite, ... just fine as long as you don't mind the low settings. For working or studying this laptop can still do the job with a core i3 and 4Gb Ram, however no graphic work since we have an Intel intergrated chip.The only thing I don't like is the touchpad. It's somehow very hard to use for me.

Reviews.Title: Defective Shift Key and USB problems
Reviews.Author: Rob "robt565"
Reviews.Content: Left Shift key died after a month, USB ports don't always function with older devices that worked fine on Windows 7.  I'd give the hardware a 3 out of 5, Asus support a 4 and Windows 8 starts at a 2 but once you figure it out it's a 4.  Hopefully, after it's repaired, it will outlast my old Gateway, which died after about 4 yrs.

Reviews.Title: Great computer, great price
Reviews.Author: Debra Van Fossen
Reviews.Content: lighting fast, it takes a little time to get use to windows 8. I haven't found anything I dislike about the computer. Great product, great price

Reviews.Title: Lovely Laptop, Great for the price - Windows8 destroys part of the value
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Lovely Laptop, Great for the price - Windows8 destroys part of the value.If it has Windows7 it would have been much better.Being an i3 - it is a little slow, even from the very beginning, to view things like photos, or browse the hard drive. it feels like this is entirely the design flaws of windows8 though. The machine would be better off running 7 or Windows3.1If I knew how to uninstall w8 and put on a decent operating system, that wasn't full of delays and detours (and poor performance of MicroSoft Office) - I would have bought more, and given one to all my staff.As it is, this is computer (which i'm writing from now) is good for browsing the internet, and low-load things - although Skype works well (after a pro-longed (time consuming) install process).Not being very technical, the user exlerience is everything - and I found that installing Chrome makes the internet much more usable - IE takes FOREVER to load on this machine. W8 is exactly that... Wait (pun on W8).Happy shopping...R

Reviews.Title: A great laptop
Reviews.Author: AmazonReviewer24
Reviews.Content: The ASUS has always had me impressed with the big screen and fast core processor. With the 17.3 inch screen it had me sold. I bought the computer separately from amazon, because I thought it would be a better deal. But big mistake. This is the best deal you can get. It is an amazing computer, I highly recommend this computer.

Reviews.Title: great product for the price
Reviews.Author: Prisoner of Society
Reviews.Content: Needed a laptop for a friend.  $400 dollars for a 17inch notebook is a good deal.  The 12month warranty is also nice.  Plus at that price you're ahead of the game if you get 24+ months out of these.I've been purchasing low cost ASUS notebooks for years.  I've never had a major issue with any of their hardware.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't compare to the old Toshiba it replaced.
Reviews.Author: w weidenbaum
Reviews.Content: Too many glitches.  The screen jumps too often from one I'm working on, and have to get back to where I started, and other "issues."  Very disappointing product.

Reviews.Title: Amazing laptop..for the price it has..but wish it was Windows 7
Reviews.Author: Neeru
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop as a gift for my father.I just loved the configuration and the price for which it comes -- just $399.I wanted to take a bigger screen laptop so that my father does not find it too small and searched for 15" and above..and finally got a 17"..which is really big but perfect!Core i3,2.4Ghz speed..500 MB RAM amazing..complete package for good performance.Only thing is that they should have had option to select the OS also.I don't like Windows 8 at all!What can one ask for more for this price??

Reviews.Title: Simple, Solid and Budget Friendly
Reviews.Author: sj
Reviews.Content: Best bang for the buck if your looking for a back to school or general use laptop.  Asus puts out some high quality and affordable technology products.  This one is another winner from Asus.  Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Had this computer for less than a month and it continually has had backlight issues making it impossible to see the screen.
Reviews.Author: GMet
Reviews.Content: Had this computer for less than a month and it continually has had backlight issues making it impossible to see the screen.  I called ASUS support for help and they actually made the problem worse.  Not only were they unable to fix it over the phone, the call center rep told me to "refresh" windows.  I did as instructed and it deleted all my programs!!!!  He did NOT tell me to back up nor did he warn me what "refresh" meant.  I now have to send in the computer AND reinstall everything.  A process that takes days.  Thanks a lot ASUS!

Reviews.Title: amazing price point and features
Reviews.Author: Donald Anthony III "donn224197"
Reviews.Content: i bought this as a replacement for my laptop i had at work (hp touchsmart) as it had finally given up the ghost.my review will be short and to the point.speed is great (though running win8 you can never have too much ram, 4 is kinda light but again per price can't complain too much)weight is lighter then i thought it'd be as i've used my girlfriends mothers 17" HP monster and it feels like carrying a small childit is a little cumbersome to carry (duh it's a large laptop)heat is something worth talking about as well, my old HP would blow air hot enough to make you wonder when you install the nuclear reactor, this ASUS is not only worlds cooler, but is silent as well. i've yet to hear the HHD nor the fan once.all in all this feels and runs much better then i would guess for a $400 laptop.negatively though i'd say that as a left handed person the keys and track pad off the the left (to make room for the number pad) is a bit of a pain and learning curve.the only thing i'm really off put on this laptop is that the track pad and left and right buttons are one. not only one but you can press the whole track pad and it's the left click button. as well there is only a little colored line to separate the left and right, no dimples or edge. i often find myself right clicking when i mean to left. again though, could just be cause i'm a lefty though.there is no dedicated area for scrolling as i was used to, rather zoom and scrolling as gestures. all in the learning curve again. not bad, just used to the way HP does things.speakers... ahh the speakers. the speakers on this are down firing so if you set it on your lap and not a hard surface for the sound waves to be reflected and send outward you could find yourself like me cranking the volume to full to hear it. i often as a result use my headphones now and that brings me to something that some may find a little tedious but doesn't bother me all that much, there is only one 3.5 jack and it doubles as a headphone and mic jack. everytime you plug it in a popup will show and asking you if it's headphones or a mic youve plugged in.i love this machine as i'm learning more and more to use it right and get the feel for it.i've for years been an HP user and i think ASUS has just won me over.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: liquidbabydoll
Reviews.Content: This has a big bright non glare screen, shared jack for headphones and microphone suks, every time you have to manually pick which one you are using and weird hassle control of screen brightness and volume on keyboard .The speakers are on the bottom of the laptop, which muffles the sound depending where its placed.The touch pad has no gripes or traction, it's as completely smooth as a baby's bottombut is huge, about 4″ x 3" inches.It's pretty darn quick and cpu benchmark is high .It was recommended to me by a top contributor on Howards forums this thing is heavy. i recommend because of price =for performance of processor

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop, Windows 8 sucks
Reviews.Author: Justin "Justin"
Reviews.Content: Laptop works well.  Nice screen, adequate performance, good trackpad.  Unfortunately, Windows 8 is confusing!  The new Internet Explorer is unusable. Hopefully the 8.1 update makes things more user friendly.  Note to Microsoft: when people buy a computer, they DO NOT WANT A TABLET.  They usually have real work to do.

Reviews.Title: ASUS X75A-DS31 17.3-Inch Laptop (Black)
Reviews.Author: kuos
Reviews.Content: WOW! what a awesome deal for a $400 laptop, not slow at all i like it a lot, gotta get use to windows 8 though,if you're on a budget like i am pick this one up you won't be disappointed. upgrading to 8gb soon with 128gb ssd

Reviews.Title: Laptop and Windows 8 highly intuitive... I just love it!
Reviews.Author: Sharon M Mason
Reviews.Content: I really like this laptop, I found the Windows 8 to be quite intuitive and similar to a smart phone screen.  This is my third ASUS product and they all work very well.  I would highly recommend this product.  By the way, all of the ASUS products are still in use.  The first one was a netbook, and the other laptop is in use downstairs, while this one is in the living room.  They're all great.  =)

Reviews.Title: So far everyone loves it
Reviews.Author: feldi
Reviews.Content: Just got it out of the box.  Loaded Kaspersky antivirus.  Done.  Downloaded Google Chrome.  Done.  Everyone loves the big screen.  Sound quality and loudness is excellant.  I have another Asus laptop and my big complaint was the sound quality and loudness.  Everyone complains about Windows 8 but so far my family has manuvered pretty well with it.  You can go to the desktop and make it look like Windows 7.  First time I wrote a review.  Will come back and write some more in a few days.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: anthony inkumsah
Reviews.Content: Descent laptop. Works well. Nothing fancy. Works well with Windows 8 and other basic functions for work and school.Time will tell

Reviews.Title: Good screen. Great touchpad.
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice laptop with a very good 1600x900 screen.  The touchpad is one the best I have used and supports Win8 well.  The touchpad is very important in Win8 especially if you don't have a touch screen.  This laptop doesn't support Widi but you can use the HDMI connection or the ActionTec ScreenBeam to output to a HDTV.  Battery life is about 3.5 hours if continuously surfing WEB, not great but not bad for 17" with 1600x900 at this price point.  Battery does charge very quickly when connected to AC.

Reviews.Title: I can't recommend this
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: ... unless you like things that run like they're ten years old. I recently "upgraded" from a 3 year old HP and this thing runs slower out of the box than my HP ever did. Even scrolling through a word document is a bit like swimming through molasses. In writing this, I honestly cannot think of any good thing about this laptop. Not even one. I've heard that ASUS is a good computer brand, perhaps a step up from HP, Dell, Toshiba, etc., but I can't think that anymore.What specifically is wrong with it? First things first, the speakers are mounted on the bottom of the computer. That's right, the bottom. Now I don't know about you, but I definitely don't have ears on my legs. Or my desk. Or my couch. The mouse gestures are ill conceived and non-intuitive. Turning them off makes using it a tad less infuriating, however the "buttons" are integrated into the trackpad itself and not fully separate so right clicking is a giant pain. I mentioned the scrolling before, but it's not limited to word documents. It's everything. Everything is sluggish, even typing this review. I play a few flash based games online in my free time and my old laptop could run them at 40 fps no problem. This thing runs the same game at about 17 fps. It's got 4 gigs of ram, but it doesn't feel like it. Also the HDD is 5400 rpm, exceedingly slow too. And then there's Windows 8. It'd probably be ok for something with a touch screen, but this is a laptop, so it's pretty annoying to use.All in all, I'm disappointed in this laptop, and I fully regret purchasing this product. I'll be sure to stay away from ASUS in the future, and I'm not looking forward to spending the next 2 or so years with this thing. It's been less than a month and I already want to chuck it out in the yard. I would, if it weren't for my budget.Buy something else.EDIT: After still using this laptop for a few months, I have a few things to add. I still think the bottom mounted speakers is just really really bad design. I've disabled the mouse gestures so the trackpad is at least usable, but right clicking while intending to left click and vice versa is still an issue. For some reason, putting the computer to sleep and waking it up seems to speed the computer up. The scroll lag is gone, and so is the flash player lag after doing this, even right after fully powering on. Win 8 is still bad, but that's not Asus's fault. And the headphone jack, which I did not mention in my initial review, but it doubles as a microphone jack. Thing is, every time you plug something into it, it asks, "is this a microphone or headphones?" It also always has the choice defaulted to microphone, because the more common thing people plug into their laptops is definitely a microphone. It would be nice if it defaulted to headphones automatically, or even just assumed such, and you had to change it manually to microphone, since most people would rarely plug in a mic to their laptop (especially a 2.5 mm jacked mic). But the biggest thing that brought me here to add this edit, screws are falling out of the laptop. I should specify that I have not opened the case, nor have any of my screwdrivers ever touched any screws on this laptop. Yet, I find that there is nothing now securing the panel over the HDD and the RAM. Yikes. This is most definitely not a minor concern or issue. I still don't recommend this laptop to anyone, but it's not wholly terrible (but it's close). I feel like you should expect more for $500.

Reviews.Title: ehhh
Reviews.Author: _mrsB_
Reviews.Content: when i opened the box, keep in mind this was "brand new", there was a hand print on the screen, hand rest marks beside the keypad. its a nice laptop. also when shipped it was in a box with the laptop box resting on the box only and air filled "pillows" on top...how that protects the laptop idk... As far as performance, this laptop is GREAT!!!! The only downside is that its running windows 8... In my opinion windows 8 should ONLY be on tablets and touch screen monitors. A lot of features that are in windows 7 are disabled in 8. The laptop is so worth the $...

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i3-2370M 2.4 GHz
4 GB DDR3
500 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
17.3-Inch Screen, Intel GMA HD
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: ASUS X75A-DS31 17.3-Inch Laptop (Black)
